alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 7:53PM CDT until April 27 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Dilworth. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Some agricultural flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Friday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening and continue falling to 12.1 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
